Personally, I like to imagine that Laythe's oceans are kept at a balmy 70 degrees Fahrenheit at the surface by the tidal friction. Obviously, that requires n-body physics that the game doesn't have. Considering that the planet's in KSP are all made out of impossibly dense unobtanium anyway, it's not too far fetched IMO for tidal friction to keep Laythe warm.

It would appear that the mobile site tools provided by Wix, which Chobit uses, are aimed at the three biggest smartphone OS's, iOS, Android, and Blackberry. As such, I wouldn't be surprised if Windows Phone users had the same problem.
I just can't seem to please everyone... sigh

I wouldn't take it personally, Chobit, in this case it's a matter of someone else lacking the foresight to realize that there are more than 3 mobile operating systems in the world.

This would be one of those cases where other people screwed up and it only looks like it's your fault. Just out of curiosity, though, is there a way to disable the live preview entirely? It would fix things, and if desktop users are browsing the mobile site for some strange reason then that's their own fault. I basically know nothing about Wix, but that sounds like an option that they might have somewhere, (probably) a checkbox sitting in some lonely corner of the GUI where no one ever looks...

I'd like to raise the question again of the practicality of a "shirt-sleeve environment" on Laythe. I remember in the original thread that during the discussion of Laythe as a home for Kerbals it was brought up that Laythe orbits directly within Jool's radiation belt, and that its surface was a sterile wasteland.

I also know from prior knowledge that water makes a highly effective radiation shield, especially at any sort of substantial depth.

Continuing with this point, this one's for you, Chobit: Why not do a drawing of an underwater Laythe base? If anything, that'd be the best way to go about colonizing Laythe.

Well I'd have to scrap a bunch of the plans I'd had for PfL, Breathe and Leisure were painted long before I was aware of intended radiation belts. All I knew is Laythe had Oxygen, Water and Sand, and that was more than enough reason to paint those images

As for an underwater Laythe base, that'd be very difficult to construct, even on Kerbin.

Maybe when they add a Saturn analogue I could convince them to make "Titan" into a Kerbin-esqe world

They'd be the best bet to escape radiation.

On a What If sent to xkcd, someone asked about how much radiation would be absorbed by swimming in a spent fuel radiation pool.

Technically, only the very surface of Laythe's oceans would receive great amounts of radiation; anything below a certain range would be considered safe.

This could play well, because it doesn't have to be so deep as to have regular pressure problems or depth and light issues, either. ;D
